comIpDhcpServer.name: comIpDhcpServer

revisions.description: V01.05.00 - Added subnetgroup and stickyaddr in order to support the point-to-multipoint feature.
V01.04.00 - Add dhcpTrapZhoneCpeSysObjectID and change cardSwCurrentVersion to zhoneSysCardSwSpecificVers in cpe detect trap.
V01.03.00 - Deprecate dhcpServerConfigurationVersion and add replacement dhcpServerRestart. Remove DEFVALs for all read-write fields.
V01.01.00 - Added dhcpTrapZhoneCpeDetected trap Added enumeration to dhcpLeaseFlags

comIpDhcpServer.contactinfo: Postal: Zhone Technologies, Inc. @ Zhone Way 7001 Oakport Street Oakland, CA 94621 USA Toll-Free: +1 877-ZHONE20 (+1 877-946-6320) Tel: +1-510-777-7000 Fax: +1-510-777-7001 E-mail: support@zhone.com
comIpDhcpServer.description: DHCP Server MIB using SNMPv2 SMI.

dhcpServer.name: dhcpServer
dhcpServer.description: Zhone DHCP Server Configuration and Monitoring MIB

dhcpServerTraps.name: dhcpServerTraps
dhcpServerTraps.description: Traps which apply to the DHCP Server.

dhcpTrapZhoneCpeDetected.name: dhcpTrapZhoneCpeDetected
dhcpTrapZhoneCpeDetected.description: Trap sent whenever an IP address is being offerred to a Zhone CPE device.

dhcpTrapZhoneCpeSysObjectID.name: dhcpTrapZhoneCpeSysObjectID
dhcpTrapZhoneCpeSysObjectID.description: System Object ID of attached Zhone CPE device

dhcpTrapZhoneIpAddressUpdate.name: dhcpTrapZhoneIpAddressUpdate
dhcpTrapZhoneIpAddressUpdate.description: Trap sent whenever the dhcp ip addresses are assigned or modified.

dhcpTrapZhoneIpInterfaceIndex.name: dhcpTrapZhoneIpInterfaceIndex
dhcpTrapZhoneIpInterfaceIndex.description: Interface Index of the ip-interface-record which contains the updated ip address. This is sent within the dhcpTrapZhoneIpAddressUpdate trap.

dhcpServerDefaultLeaseTime.name: dhcpServerDefaultLeaseTime
dhcpServerDefaultLeaseTime.description: The global default time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease if the client requesting the lease does not ask for a specific expiration time. Default value is 43200 seconds.

dhcpServerDefaultMinLeaseTime.name: dhcpServerDefaultMinLeaseTime
dhcpServerDefaultMinLeaseTime.description: The global minimum expiration time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. Default value is 0

dhcpServerDefaultMaxLeaseTime.name: dhcpServerDefaultMaxLeaseTime
dhcpServerDefaultMaxLeaseTime.description: The global maximum time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. Default value is 86400 seconds.

dhcpServerDefaultReserveStart.name: dhcpServerDefaultReserveStart
dhcpServerDefaultReserveStart.description: The default number of IP addresses at the start of a subnet's IP address space that are reserved by the DHCP server. To override this default a specific subnet rule must be created for each subnet that needs to be handled differently. Default value is 5

dhcpServerDefaultReserveEnd.name: dhcpServerDefaultReserveEnd
dhcpServerDefaultReserveEnd.description: The default number of IP addresses at the end of a subnet's IP address space that are reserved by the DHCP server. To override this default a specific subnet rule must be created for each subnet that needs to be handled differently. Default value is 5

dhcpServerLeaseTable.name: dhcpServerLeaseTable
dhcpServerLeaseTable.description: Provides access to the DHCP Server Client Lease Database

dhcpServerLeaseEntry.name: dhcpServerLeaseEntry
dhcpServerLeaseEntry.description: Required server lease fields: dhcpLeaseDomain, dhcpLeaseIpAddres, dhcpLeaseStarts, dhcpLeaseEnds Plus at lease one of: dhcpLeaseHardwareAddress, dhcpLeaseClientId

dhcpLeaseDomain.name: dhcpLeaseDomain
dhcpLeaseDomain.description: Routing domain of the client the lease was created for.

dhcpLeaseStarts.name: dhcpLeaseStarts
dhcpLeaseStarts.description: Time in GMT that the lease was assigned.

dhcpLeaseEnds.name: dhcpLeaseEnds
dhcpLeaseEnds.description: Time in GMT that the lease will expire.

dhcpLeaseHardwareAddress.name: dhcpLeaseHardwareAddress
dhcpLeaseHardwareAddress.description: The MAC address of the network interface that was used to acquire the lease.

dhcpLeaseFlags.name: dhcpLeaseFlags
dhcpLeaseFlags.description: Lease flags currently defined as follows. #define STATIC_LEASE 1 #define BOOTP_LEASE 2 #define ABANDONED_LEASE 16 #define ZHONE_CPE 32 The default value for this object is 0 (no bits up).

dhcpLeaseClientId.name: dhcpLeaseClientId
dhcpLeaseClientId.description: Client identifier (if any) the client used to acquire its address. The default value for this object is an empty octet string.

dhcpLeaseClientHostname.name: dhcpLeaseClientHostname
dhcpLeaseClientHostname.description: Client hostname (if any) the client used to acquire its address. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpLeaseHostname.name: dhcpLeaseHostname
dhcpLeaseHostname.description: Client hostname (if any) the client used to acquire its address. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpLeaseDDNSFwdName.name: dhcpLeaseDDNSFwdName
dhcpLeaseDDNSFwdName.description: Dynamic DNS forward host name. Not currently used. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpLeaseDDNSRevName.name: dhcpLeaseDDNSRevName
dhcpLeaseDDNSRevName.description: Dynamic DNS reverse host name. Not currently used. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpLeaseRowStatus.name: dhcpLeaseRowStatus
dhcpLeaseRowStatus.description: Used to create and/or remove rows from this table.

dhcpServerNextGroupIndex.name: dhcpServerNextGroupIndex
dhcpServerNextGroupIndex.description: This object will return the next valid value for dhcpGroupIndex. This is used to manage the indices for the dhcpServerGroupTable. Upon creating a row in the dhcpServerGroupTable, the user must first obtain the next index by performing a get on this object.

dhcpServerGroupTable.name: dhcpServerGroupTable
dhcpServerGroupTable.description: Provides access to the DHCP Server Group object configurations.

dhcpServerGroupEntry.name: dhcpServerGroupEntry
dhcpServerGroupEntry.description: Required group object fields: dhcpGroupIndex, dhcpGroupName, dhcpGroupDomain, Plus one of: dhcpGroupVendorMatchString, dhcpGroupClientMatchString The value for dhcpGroupIndex must be obtained by performing a GET on dhcpServerNextGroupIndex.

dhcpGroupName.name: dhcpGroupName
dhcpGroupName.description: Group object name. The default value for this object is the empty string.

dhcpGroupDomain.name: dhcpGroupDomain
dhcpGroupDomain.description: Routing domain that this group object applies to.

dhcpGroupVendorMatchString.name: dhcpGroupVendorMatchString
dhcpGroupVendorMatchString.description: Vendor class identifier match string that is used to determine which clients should be placed in this group. The default value for this object is an empty octet string.

dhcpGroupVendorMatchOffset.name: dhcpGroupVendorMatchOffset
dhcpGroupVendorMatchOffset.description: Offset into the client passed vendor class identifier string where the string match should start.

dhcpGroupVendorMatchLength.name: dhcpGroupVendorMatchLength
dhcpGroupVendorMatchLength.description: Length of the vendor class identifier substring to match. A value of -1 indicates that the entire string starting at the match offset value should be matched.

dhcpGroupClientMatchString.name: dhcpGroupClientMatchString
dhcpGroupClientMatchString.description: Client identifier match string that is used to determine which clients should be placed in this group. The default value for this object is an empty octet string.

dhcpGroupClientMatchOffset.name: dhcpGroupClientMatchOffset
dhcpGroupClientMatchOffset.description: Offset into the client passed client identifier string where the string match should start.

dhcpGroupClientMatchLength.name: dhcpGroupClientMatchLength
dhcpGroupClientMatchLength.description: Length of the client identifier substring to match. A value of -1 indicates that the entire string starting at the match offset value should be matched.

dhcpGroupRowStatus.name: dhcpGroupRowStatus
dhcpGroupRowStatus.description: Used to create and/or remove rows from this table.

dhcpServerGroupOptionEntry.name: dhcpServerGroupOptionEntry
dhcpServerGroupOptionEntry.description: All fields in this table are optional.

dhcpGroupOptionDefaultLeaseTime.name: dhcpGroupOptionDefaultLeaseTime
dhcpGroupOptionDefaultLeaseTime.description: The default time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease if the client requesting the lease does not ask for a specific expiration time. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpGroupOptionMinLeaseTime.name: dhcpGroupOptionMinLeaseTime
dhcpGroupOptionMinLeaseTime.description: The minimum expiration time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpGroupOptionMaxLeaseTime.name: dhcpGroupOptionMaxLeaseTime
dhcpGroupOptionMaxLeaseTime.description: The maximum time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpGroupOptionBootFile.name: dhcpGroupOptionBootFile
dhcpGroupOptionBootFile.description: Name of the initial boot file which is to be loaded by the client. The filename should be a filename recognizable to whatever file transfer protocol the client can be expected to use to load the file. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpGroupOptionBootServer.name: dhcpGroupOptionBootServer
dhcpGroupOptionBootServer.description: IP Address of the server from which the initial boot file (specified in the BootFile option) is to be loaded. If this IP address is specified as 0.0.0.0 then primary interface address of the DHCP Server is used. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpGroupOptionDefaultRouter.name: dhcpGroupOptionDefaultRouter
dhcpGroupOptionDefaultRouter.description: IP Address of the client's default gateway. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpGroupOptionPrimaryNameServer.name: dhcpGroupOptionPrimaryNameServer
dhcpGroupOptionPrimaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the primary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpGroupOptionSecondaryNameServer.name: dhcpGroupOptionSecondaryNameServer
dhcpGroupOptionSecondaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the secondary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpGroupOptionDomainName.name: dhcpGroupOptionDomainName
dhcpGroupOptionDomainName.description: The default domain name that the client should use when resolving hostnames via DNS. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpServerNextSubnetIndex.name: dhcpServerNextSubnetIndex
dhcpServerNextSubnetIndex.description: This object will return the next valid value for dhcpSubnetIndex. This is used to manage the indices for the dhcpServerSubnetTable. Upon creating a row in the dhcpServerSubnetTable, the user must first obtain the next index by performing a get on this object.

dhcpServerSubnetTable.name: dhcpServerSubnetTable
dhcpServerSubnetTable.description: Provides access to the DHCP Server Subnet object configurations.

dhcpServerSubnetEntry.name: dhcpServerSubnetEntry
dhcpServerSubnetEntry.description: Required subnet object fields: dhcpSubnetIndex, dhcpSubnetNetwork, dhcpSubnetNetmask, dhcpSubnetDomain, dhcpSubnetRange1Start, dhcpSubnetRange1End. The value for dhcpSubnetIndex must be obtained by performing a GET on dhcpServerNextSubnetIndex.

dhcpSubnetNetwork.name: dhcpSubnetNetwork
dhcpSubnetNetwork.description: Network address of this subnet object.

dhcpSubnetNetmask.name: dhcpSubnetNetmask
dhcpSubnetNetmask.description: Network mask of this subnet object.

dhcpSubnetDomain.name: dhcpSubnetDomain
dhcpSubnetDomain.description: Routing domain that this subnet object applies to.

dhcpSubnetRange1Start.name: dhcpSubnetRange1Start
dhcpSubnetRange1Start.description: Starting IP address of the first address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange1End.name: dhcpSubnetRange1End
dhcpSubnetRange1End.description: Last IP address of the first address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange2Start.name: dhcpSubnetRange2Start
dhcpSubnetRange2Start.description: Starting IP address of the second address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange2End.name: dhcpSubnetRange2End
dhcpSubnetRange2End.description: Last IP address of the second address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange3Start.name: dhcpSubnetRange3Start
dhcpSubnetRange3Start.description: Starting IP address of the third address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange3End.name: dhcpSubnetRange3End
dhcpSubnetRange3End.description: Last IP address of the third address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange4Start.name: dhcpSubnetRange4Start
dhcpSubnetRange4Start.description: Starting IP address of the fourth address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRange4End.name: dhcpSubnetRange4End
dhcpSubnetRange4End.description: Last IP address of the fourth address pool in this subnet. If either the start or end range has a value of 0 then the entire address pool is ignored.

dhcpSubnetRowStatus.name: dhcpSubnetRowStatus
dhcpSubnetRowStatus.description: Used to create and/or remove rows from this table.

dhcpSubnetGroup2.name: dhcpSubnetGroup2
dhcpSubnetGroup2.description: A number which indicates which DHCP subnet group this pool is a member of. A value of 0 ( default) indicates not a member of any group.

dhcpStickyAddr.name: dhcpStickyAddr
dhcpStickyAddr.description: If true we will attempt to hand out the same IP address to the same host, when possible based on HW address. Default value is TRUE for backwards compatability.

dhcpSubnetExternalServer.name: dhcpSubnetExternalServer
dhcpSubnetExternalServer.description: Non-null IP address value indicates use of external DHCP server instead of internal for this subnet.

dhcpSubnetExternalServerAlt.name: dhcpSubnetExternalServerAlt
dhcpSubnetExternalServerAlt.description: Non-null IP address value indicates use of alternate external DHCP server.

dhcpServerSubnetOptionEntry.name: dhcpServerSubnetOptionEntry
dhcpServerSubnetOptionEntry.description: All fields in this table are optional.

dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultLeaseTime.name: dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultLeaseTime
dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultLeaseTime.description: The default time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease if the client requesting the lease does not ask for a specific expiration time. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpSubnetOptionMinLeaseTime.name: dhcpSubnetOptionMinLeaseTime
dhcpSubnetOptionMinLeaseTime.description: The minimum expiration time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpSubnetOptionMaxLeaseTime.name: dhcpSubnetOptionMaxLeaseTime
dhcpSubnetOptionMaxLeaseTime.description: The maximum time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpSubnetOptionBootFile.name: dhcpSubnetOptionBootFile
dhcpSubnetOptionBootFile.description: Name of the initial boot file which is to be loaded by the client. The filename should be a filename recognizable to whatever file transfer protocol the client can be expected to use to load the file. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpSubnetOptionBootServer.name: dhcpSubnetOptionBootServer
dhcpSubnetOptionBootServer.description: IP Address of the server from which the initial boot file (specified in the BootFile option) is to be loaded. If this IP address is specified as 0.0.0.0 then the DHCP Server's address is used. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultRouter.name: dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultRouter
dhcpSubnetOptionDefaultRouter.description: IP Address of the client's default gateway. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpSubnetOptionPrimaryNameServer.name: dhcpSubnetOptionPrimaryNameServer
dhcpSubnetOptionPrimaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the primary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpSubnetOptionSecondaryNameServer.name: dhcpSubnetOptionSecondaryNameServer
dhcpSubnetOptionSecondaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the secondary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpSubnetOptionDomainName.name: dhcpSubnetOptionDomainName
dhcpSubnetOptionDomainName.description: The default domain name that the client should use when resolving hostnames via DNS. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpServerNextHostIndex.name: dhcpServerNextHostIndex
dhcpServerNextHostIndex.description: This object will return the next valid value for dhcpHostIndex. This is used to manage the indices for the dhcpServerHostTable. Upon creating a row in the dhcpServerHostTable, the user must first obtain the next index by performing a get on this object.

dhcpServerHostTable.name: dhcpServerHostTable
dhcpServerHostTable.description: Provides access to the DHCP Server Host object configurations.

dhcpServerHostEntry.name: dhcpServerHostEntry
dhcpServerHostEntry.description: Required host object fields: dhcpHostIndex, dhcpHostDomain, Plus one of: dhcpHostHardwareAddress, dhcpHostClientId The value for dhcpHostIndex must be obtained by performing a GET on dhcpServerNextHostIndex.

dhcpHostHostname.name: dhcpHostHostname
dhcpHostHostname.description: Hostname for this client. This may or may not be fully qualified with the local domain name but it is preferable to use the dhcpHostOptionDomainName option to specify the domain name. The default value for this field is an empty string.

dhcpHostDomain.name: dhcpHostDomain
dhcpHostDomain.description: Routing domain that this host object applies to.

dhcpHostHardwareAddress.name: dhcpHostHardwareAddress
dhcpHostHardwareAddress.description: Hardware address of the client that matches this host object. If the dhcpHostClientId field is specified then this field is ignored. However, at least one of these fields must be configured per host object.

dhcpHostClientId.name: dhcpHostClientId
dhcpHostClientId.description: DHCP client identifier of the client that matches this host object. If this field is specified then the dhcpHostHardwareAddress value is not used. However, at least one of these fields must be configured per host object. The default value for this object is an empty octet string.

dhcpHostIpAddress1.name: dhcpHostIpAddress1
dhcpHostIpAddress1.description: Fixed IP address that should be assigned to this client.

dhcpHostIpAddress2.name: dhcpHostIpAddress2
dhcpHostIpAddress2.description: Fixed IP address that should be assigned to this client.

dhcpHostIpAddress3.name: dhcpHostIpAddress3
dhcpHostIpAddress3.description: Fixed IP address that should be assigned to this client.

dhcpHostIpAddress4.name: dhcpHostIpAddress4
dhcpHostIpAddress4.description: Fixed IP address that should be assigned to this client.

dhcpHostRowStatus.name: dhcpHostRowStatus
dhcpHostRowStatus.description: Used to create and/or remove rows from this table.

dhcpServerHostOptionEntry.name: dhcpServerHostOptionEntry
dhcpServerHostOptionEntry.description: All fields in this table are optional.

dhcpHostOptionDefaultLeaseTime.name: dhcpHostOptionDefaultLeaseTime
dhcpHostOptionDefaultLeaseTime.description: The default time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease if the client requesting the lease does not ask for a specific expiration time. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpHostOptionMinLeaseTime.name: dhcpHostOptionMinLeaseTime
dhcpHostOptionMinLeaseTime.description: The minimum expiration time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpHostOptionMaxLeaseTime.name: dhcpHostOptionMaxLeaseTime
dhcpHostOptionMaxLeaseTime.description: The maximum time in seconds that will be assigned to a lease regardless of the value specified by a client. A value of -1 indicates that this field should be ignored. Default value is -1 seconds.

dhcpHostOptionBootFile.name: dhcpHostOptionBootFile
dhcpHostOptionBootFile.description: Name of the initial boot file which is to be loaded by the client. The filename should be a filename recognizable to whatever file transfer protocol the client can be expected to use to load the file. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpHostOptionBootServer.name: dhcpHostOptionBootServer
dhcpHostOptionBootServer.description: IP Address of the server from which the initial boot file (specified in the BootFile option) is to be loaded. If this IP address is specified as 0.0.0.0 then the DHCP Server's address is used. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpHostOptionDefaultRouter.name: dhcpHostOptionDefaultRouter
dhcpHostOptionDefaultRouter.description: IP Address of the client's default gateway. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpHostOptionPrimaryNameServer.name: dhcpHostOptionPrimaryNameServer
dhcpHostOptionPrimaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the primary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpHostOptionSecondaryNameServer.name: dhcpHostOptionSecondaryNameServer
dhcpHostOptionSecondaryNameServer.description: IP Address of the secondary domain name server that the client should use for DNS resolution. Default value is 0.0.0.0

dhcpHostOptionDomainName.name: dhcpHostOptionDomainName
dhcpHostOptionDomainName.description: The default domain name that the client should use when resolving hostnames via DNS. The default value for this object is an empty string.

dhcpServerStatistics.name: dhcpServerStatistics
dhcpServerStatistics.description: DHCP Server MIB statistic objects are all defined in this branch.
dhcpServerStatistics.reference: Based on IETF draft DHCP Server MIB. See: http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-ietf-dhc-server-mib-04.txt

serverSystem.name: serverSystem
serverSystem.description: Group of objects that are related to the overall system.

serverSystemDescr.name: serverSystemDescr
serverSystemDescr.description: A textual description of the server. This value should include the full name and version identification of the server. This string MUST contain only printable NVT ASCII characters.

serverSystemObjectID.name: serverSystemObjectID
serverSystemObjectID.description: The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in this entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprise subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining 'what kind of server' is being managed. For example, if vendor 'VeryBigServers, Inc.' is assigned the subtree 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it may assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Hercules DHCP Server'.

serverUptime.name: serverUptime
serverUptime.description: The value of sysUpTime when the server started handling requests.

serverActiveShelf.name: serverActiveShelf
serverActiveShelf.description: The shelf ID of the active DHCP server.

serverActiveSlot.name: serverActiveSlot
serverActiveSlot.description: The slot ID of the active DHCP server.

serverStandbyShelf.name: serverStandbyShelf
serverStandbyShelf.description: The shelf ID of the standby DHCP server.

serverStandbySlot.name: serverStandbySlot
serverStandbySlot.description: The slot ID of the standby DHCP server.

bootpCountersTable.name: bootpCountersTable
bootpCountersTable.reference: Based on IETF draft DHCP Server MIB. See: http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-ietf-dhc-server-mib-04.txt
bootpCountersTable.description: Table indexed on routing domain of objects that count various BOOTP events.

bootpCountersEntry.name: bootpCountersEntry
bootpCountersEntry.description: Group of objects that count various BOOTP events on a per routing domain basis.

bootpCountRequests.name: bootpCountRequests
bootpCountRequests.description: The number of packets received that contain a Message Type of 1 (BOOTREQUEST) in the first octet and do not contain option number 53 (DHCP Message Type) in the options.

bootpCountInvalids.name: bootpCountInvalids
bootpCountInvalids.description: The number of packets received that do not contain a Message Type of 1 (BOOTREQUEST) in the first octet or are not valid BOOTP packets (e.g., too short, invalid field in packet header).

bootpCountReplies.name: bootpCountReplies
bootpCountReplies.description: The number of packets sent that contain a Message Type of 1 (BOOTREQUEST) in the first octet and do not contain option number 53 (DHCP Message Type) in the options.

bootpCountDroppedUnknownClients.name: bootpCountDroppedUnknownClients
bootpCountDroppedUnknownClients.description: The number of BOOTP packets dropped due to the server not recognizing or not providing service to the hardware address received in the incoming packet.

bootpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet.name: bootpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet
bootpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet.description: The number of BOOTP packets dropped due to the server not being configured or not otherwise able to serve addresses on the subnet from which this message was received.

dhcpCountersTable.name: dhcpCountersTable
dhcpCountersTable.reference: Based on IETF draft DHCP Server MIB. See: http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-ietf-dhc-server-mib-04.txt
dhcpCountersTable.description: Table indexed on routing domain of objects that count various DHCP events.

dhcpCountersEntry.name: dhcpCountersEntry
dhcpCountersEntry.description: Group of objects that count various DHCP events on a per routing domain basis.

dhcpCountDiscovers.name: dhcpCountDiscovers
dhcpCountDiscovers.description: The number of DHCPDISCOVER (option 53 with value 1) packets received.

dhcpCountRequests.name: dhcpCountRequests
dhcpCountRequests.description: The number of DHCPREQUEST (option 53 with value 3) packets received.

dhcpCountReleases.name: dhcpCountReleases
dhcpCountReleases.description: The number of DHCPRELEASE (option 53 with value 7) packets received.

dhcpCountDeclines.name: dhcpCountDeclines
dhcpCountDeclines.description: The number of DHCPDECLINE (option 53 with value 4) packets received.

dhcpCountInforms.name: dhcpCountInforms
dhcpCountInforms.description: The number of DHCPINFORM (option 53 with value 8) packets received.

dhcpCountInvalids.name: dhcpCountInvalids
dhcpCountInvalids.description: The number of DHCP packets received whose DHCP message type (i.e., option number 53) is not understood or handled by the server.

dhcpCountOffers.name: dhcpCountOffers
dhcpCountOffers.description: The number of DHCPOFFER (option 53 with value 2) packets sent.

dhcpCountAcks.name: dhcpCountAcks
dhcpCountAcks.description: The number of DHCPACK (option 53 with value 5) packets sent.

dhcpCountNacks.name: dhcpCountNacks
dhcpCountNacks.description: The number of DHCPNACK (option 53 with value 6) packets sent.

dhcpCountDroppedUnknownClient.name: dhcpCountDroppedUnknownClient
dhcpCountDroppedUnknownClient.description: The number of DHCP packets dropped due to the server not recognizing or not providing service to the client-id and/or hardware address received in the incoming packet.

dhcpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet.name: dhcpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet
dhcpCountDroppedNotServingSubnet.description: The number of DHCP packets dropped due to the server not being configured or not otherwise able to serve addresses on the subnet from which this message was received.

dhcpServerConfigurationVersion.name: dhcpServerConfigurationVersion
dhcpServerConfigurationVersion.description: Version number of the current DHCP server configuration. If this value is changed the server will reload all configuration rules and reinitialize itself. Any configuration rules modified before this field is changed will not have any affect on the currently running DHCP server configuration.

dhcpServerRestart.name: dhcpServerRestart
dhcpServerRestart.description: If set to value 'true(1)' indicates that the server should restart by doing a complete reload of it's configuration. The value of this field will be reset to 'false(2)' once the restart command has been acknowledged by the server. A restart would typically only be done after making manual changes to the DHCP server lease table. All other configuration changes done via SNMP are automatically loaded by the server. Default value is 'false(2)'
